title.native: きまぐれオレンジ☆ロード

description:
It can be hard moving to a new school, and fifteen-year-old Kyosuke has it harder than most. He’s fallen head over heels for his classmate Madoka, a girl who won’t even give him the time of day, and unintentionally ended up dating her best friend, Hikaru, instead. Worst of all, Kyosuke and his family have amazing supernatural powers, but he has to keep them hidden from the rest of the world! How is Kyosuke ever going to balance the affections (or lack thereof) of two girls, schoolwork, and his secret abilities all at the same time?

(Source: Discotek Media)

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShiroSAGISU_twi)

__Non-Anime Credits:__ 
- Music composer for ''Neon Genesis Evangelion'' (N64, VG) (Japanese) 
- Music composer for ''Shining Force Neo'' (VG)
- Music composer for ''Attack on Titan (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for'' Attack on Titan II: End of the World (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for ''Shin Godzilla''
- Music composer for ''Shin Ultraman''

[Website](http://takada-akemi.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AngelTouchPlus)

Akemi Takada is a Japanese artist and illustrator, and was born on March 31 in Tokyo, Japan. She is a popular anime character designer who attended Tama Art University, and then worked for Tatsunoko Pro following her graduation. She is currently a freelance illustrator with her own studio, though she is also a member of the creative group Headgear. She also has her own designer jewelry store called Diakosmos.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小林治_(アニメ演出家%29) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osamu_Kobayashi_(animation_director%29)

Osamu Kobayashi is a Japanese director and animator best known for [Creamy Mami](https://anilist.co/anime/2044/). In 1963, he entered Toei Animation at the same time as [Tsutomu Shibayama](https://anilist.co/staff/119556/) and [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/). He was a chief animator working with Shibayama after having transferred to a A Production. In 1978, he established [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) together with Shibayama.

_Note: Not to be confused with the 1964 born director, [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大西雅也)

Long-time key member of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/). Married to [Takako Oonishi](https://anilist.co/staff/139180/).

Yuuji Nunokawa was a planner, producer, as well as the founder and representative director of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/).

Worked at [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) as an animator and director through the '70s before becoming a producer.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shichiro_kobayashi/)

A former art director and a guest professor at Kobe Design University.

Kobayashi graduated from Musashino Art University and first became an elementary school art teacher. It was only later that he joined the animation industry in 1964. He started quickly making a name for himself as a background artist and consequently established his own background art studio Kobayashi Production, in 1968. During this time thick poster paint was dominating the backgrounds in anime, but Kobayashi started a new style with much thinner painting and colored pencil strokes.

He has worked as an art director on over 100 titles and is one of the most distinguished art directors in the medium. Notable works include [Gamba no Bouken](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/), [Ie Naki Ko](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/), [Takarajima](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/), [Tenshi no Tamago](https://anilist.co/anime/885/), [Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/) and [Nodame Cantabile](https://anilist.co/anime/1698/).

Kobayashi retired from the industry in 2010, which was followed by his studio's closedown a year later.

In a 2015 [interview](https://youtu.be/V1tiKOsCz2M), Kobayashi talked about his life and passion in painting touring his atelier and showcasing his work.

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小林治_(アニメ演出家%29) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osamu_Kobayashi_(animation_director%29)

Osamu Kobayashi is a Japanese director and animator best known for [Creamy Mami](https://anilist.co/anime/2044/). In 1963, he entered Toei Animation at the same time as [Tsutomu Shibayama](https://anilist.co/staff/119556/) and [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/). He was a chief animator working with Shibayama after having transferred to a A Production. In 1978, he established [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) together with Shibayama.

_Note: Not to be confused with the 1964 born director, [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).
